metadata.title: USN-6659-1 -- libde265 vulnerabilities
metadata.description: It was discovered that libde265 could be made to write out of bounds. If a user or automated system were tricked into opening a specially crafted file, an attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service or execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2022-43244, CVE-2022-43249, CVE-2022-43250, CVE-2022-47665, CVE-2023-25221)  It was discovered that libde265 could be made to read out of bounds. If a user or automated system were tricked into opening a specially crafted file, an attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service. (CVE-2022-43245)  It was discovered that libde265 could be made to dereference invalid memory. If a user or automated system were tricked into opening a specially crafted file, an attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service. (CVE-2023-24751, CVE-2023-24752, CVE-2023-24754, CVE-2023-24755, CVE-2023-24756, CVE-2023-24757, CVE-2023-24758)  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-6659-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  libde265-0 - 1.0.2-2ubuntu0.16.04.1~esm3 libde265-examples - 1.0.2-2ubuntu0.16.04.1~esm3 libde265-dev - 1.0.2-2ubuntu0.16.04.1~esm3 Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro
